titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stanford Presidential Lectures in the Humanities and Arts Videorecordings
Stanford Presidential Lectures in the Humanities and Arts videorecordings
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Stanford Presidential Lectures in the Humanities and Arts.

did.unittitle: Stanford Presidential Lectures in the Humanities and Arts videorecordings
did.abstract: Lecturers represented in this collection include Svetlana Alpers (art history), Elaine Scarry (human rights and the humanities), Lynn Hunt (the novel and human rights), Hazel V. Carby (racializing subjects in post-World War II Britain), Wendy Doniger (self-imitation in ancient India, Shakespeare and Hollywood), Merce Cunningham (in conversation with John Rockwell, dance critic for the NY Times), and Douglas R. Hofstadter (analogy as the core of cognition).

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: Access: tapes that are not VHS will need to be reformatted prior to use.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: . Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: The Stanford Presidential Lectures in the Humanities and Arts brings the most distinguished scholars, artists, and critics of our time to the Stanford University campus for lectures, seminars, panel discussions, and a variety of related interactions with faculty, students, and the community at large.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Lecturers represented in this collection include Svetlana Alpers (art history), Elaine Scarry (human rights and the humanities), Lynn Hunt (the novel and human rights), Hazel V. Carby (racializing subjects in post-World War II Britain), Wendy Doniger (self-imitation in ancient India, Shakespeare and Hollywood), Merce Cunningham (in conversation with John Rockwell, dance critic for the NY Times), and Douglas R. Hofstadter (analogy as the core of cognition).

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.corpname: Stanford Presidential Lectures in the Humanities and Arts.
